refnamediv.refpurpose: Generic manual page for telescope (mount) drivers.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page describes focuser drivers available for RTS2, and common options for mount (telescope) drivers. For description of options common to all devices, please consult rts2-device7.

refsect1.title: Common variables
refsect1.para: Mount interface provides common variables, visible in rts2-mon1 and rts2-xmlrpcclient1. They govern focuser behaviour and show its state. They are described below.

varlistentry.para: This variable specifies flipping strategy used by the mount. Flip is common problem on German Equatorial Mount (GEM), where a certain object (RA DEC position on sky) can be observed on two different DEC and RA axis coordinates. Possible values are:

If both flip are possible, the shortest will select one which will travel lower distance at any axes. Specifically, the algorithm calculates maximum of differences between current and target position in DEC and RA, and select flip which leads to lower value.
This is the default value, as it leads to the best use of night time.
If possible, flip stays same as is the current flip. This setting is indended for cases when the observations for callibration purposes should be as long as possible on the same flip.
Opposite to the same setting, this forces every possible movement to flip. Usefull mostly for telescope long slew sles.

Flip mount to west side. The definition is arbitrary and depends on mount parameters, particurarly zero offsets. BUt in most cases, west flip means the telescope is west from meridian, counterweight on east.
Similar to west flip, prefers flip on east side.
Opposite to shortest. Does not provides any benefits, but can be used to test mount performance.
